ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a lot of reading comprehension, auditory, and communication skills in my class. We were able to cram so much information into only one semester, which was great.
Conversational Spanish
I learned a foreign language which proved very useful in my trips to Costa Rica and Mexico.
I developed the abilities to read, write, and speak in Spanish at a basic level.
It was a fantastic introduction to the Spanish language. I felt like the pace was reasonable, and that the instruction was good.
I learned the basics of Spanish, including grammar, vocal, how to form full sentences to have a conversation with someone, and how to listen and answer questions in Spanish.
I learned how to speak, read, and write basic Spanish.
Spanish skills. I can now understand the language and speak with limited ability.
This was a very intense but effective introductory course. Having completed it, I feel that I have basic knowledge in reading, writing, speaking, and comprehending Spanish.
Spanish level one gives a great introduction to Spanish and Latino culture and language. Students became fairly proficient in listening and reading.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The book that this course uses is a great one. The activities online are always straightforward and conducive to the learning. It would be great if the DUS could offer past tests from the previous years to assist future students in preparing for the tests if that could be a possibility.
It's a great course, easy to stay on top of, especially if you do work ahead of time, which is very doable.
Strengths: Daily engagement ensures practice for students

It was very useful that it was held everyday. It allowed the lessons to stick to our memories through daily practice. I also like a that the class was conducted in pure Spanish which really necessitated us to learn it as well as get us used to hearing the language. All the materials used were very helpful and my professor was the best. I cant think of any weakness except maybe it's too short (50 minutes only).
Early on, having class entirely in Spanish was less helpful than it would have been with some English. It was initially very difficult to keep up with what was being said in class.
I felt the pace was good. However, I thought that sometimes the homework was arduous.

The strengths of this course are the small classroom setting and the fact that the professor and students alike are all so engaged for the fifty five minutes. One of the weaknesses was that our classroom was quite filled and very far away from Old Campus.

The strengths of the course are the variety of activities used to teach the material. Specifically, the listening activities, in-class discussion, and role playing were all helpful for me. I did not think that the online homework was incredibly effective at cementing concepts, as its orientation could be confusing. An initial weakness of the course is that it is taught completely in Spanish - this is understandable for people that have background knowledge in the language, but as someone that did not know any Spanish at the beginning of the semester, I found it difficult to learn and ask questions.

The organization is the strength of the course. I was able to do my homework many days in advance thanks to the syllabus. Sometimes, I found that the oral exam expected too much out of a level one student. Speaking seems to come later in the Yale Spanish curriculum.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If a student wants to gain a solid foundation in Spanish, then this is the class for them. It's a great Intro. to Spanish class.
Definitely! But choose the right instructor and work ahead of time if you can
Yes, a great way to acquire a new language
Yes, the ability to speak another language is a very important skill, and particularly so when that language is spoken in many places.
Yes
Yes, It is a great course if you want to learn the basics of Spanish.
I would definitely recommend this course to a beginner-level student who wanted to learn Spanish.
Yes definitely!
I would recommend, it is a very effective introductory course.
Spanish level one is a must take course if you are at all interested in the Spanish language. College is a wonderful time to be learning languages.
